Claims.expr: N = number of distinct 2x2x2 cubes from 8 distinct unit cubes up to rotations (reflections distinct)
rotations of the cube are considered the same
Fix one specific cube (purple) in top-left-front position
Three positions adjacent to purple (sharing faces)
Ways to choose 3 cubes for adjacent positions: binom(7,3)
Rotations fixing purple position: order 3 (0, 120, 240 degrees around corner axis)
These rotations cycle the 3 adjacent positions
For chosen 3 cubes, assignments to 3 positions: 3!
Remaining positions after fixing purple and 3 adjacent: 4
Total with purple fixed, up to stabilizer: binom(7,3) * 2 * 4!
This equals total N, as fixing specific cube in position and quotienting by stabilizer gives orbit count (equivalent to 8! / 24)
smaller of the two distinct prime factors of 316990099009901 = 32016000000000001 / 101
smaller of the two distinct prime factors of (binom(7,3) + 316990099009866) = 32016000000000001 / 101
N = number of rearrangements of the multiset with 6 H, 12 M, 6 T such that every run of identical letters has length at least 2
The word is "HMMT" repeated 6 times, so multiset has 6 H, 12 M, 6 T
The condition 'each letter is adjacent to another copy of the same letter' means no isolated letters, i.e., all run lengths >= 2
N can be computed via DP: let dp[u_h][u_m][u_t][last][state] be the number of ways to use u_h H, u_m M, u_t T, ending with letter last (0=H,1=M,2=T), state=0 if current run length=1, state=1 if >=2
Initial: dp[0][0][0][dummy][1] = 1, transitions: continue same letter if state allows and counts remain; switch only if previous state=1 (or start), start new state=0; continue updates state to 1
N = sum over last=0 to 2 of dp[6][12][6][last][1] = 78556
N = number of rearrangements of the multiset with (P - 4001995) H, 12 M, (P - 4001995) T such that every run of identical letters has length at least 2

Math_Problem: I have 8 unit cubes of different colors, which I want to glue together into a $2 \times 2 \times 2$ cube. How many distinct $2 \times 2 \times 2$ cubes can I make? Rotations of the same cube are not considered distinct, but reflections are. Instead of determining the number of distinct assemblies up to rotational symmetry, simply find $m = \binom{7}{3}$, where $m$ is the number of ways to choose three of the remaining seven cubes for the three positions that share a face with the fixed cube. The number $$m + 316990099009866=\\frac{32016000000000001}{101}$$ is the product of two distinct prime numbers. Compute the smaller of these two primes. Instead of determining the smaller prime factor of the given composite number, simply find $k = P - 4001995$, where $P$ is the smaller of these two distinct prime numbers. Let $N$ be the number of ways in which the letters in a multiset consisting of $k$ H's, 12 M's, and $k$ T's can be rearranged so that each letter is adjacent to another copy of the same letter. For example, "MMMMMMTTTTTTHHHHHHHHHHHH" satisfies this property, but "HMMMMMTTTTTTHHHHHHHHHHHM" does not. Estimate $N$. An estimate of $E$ will earn $\\left\\lfloor 20 \\min \\left(\\frac{N}{E}, \\frac{E}{N}\\right)^{4}\\right\\rfloor$ points.

Synthesised_By.A595: I have 8 unit cubes of different colors, which I want to glue together into a $2 \times 2 \times 2$ cube. How many distinct $2 \times 2 \times 2$ cubes can I make? Rotations of the same cube are not considered distinct, but reflections are.

Synthesised_By.A1494: The number $$316990099009901=\frac{32016000000000001}{101}$$ is the product of two distinct prime numbers. Compute the smaller of these two primes.

Synthesised_By.A2567: Let $N$ be the number of ways in which the letters in "HMMTHMMTHMMTHMMTHMMTHMMT" ("HMMT" repeated six times) can be rearranged so that each letter is adjacent to another copy of the same letter. For example, "MMMMMMTTTTTTHHHHHHHHHHHH" satisfies this property, but "HMMMMMTTTTTTHHHHHHHHHHHM" does not. Estimate $N$. An estimate of $E$ will earn $\left\lfloor 20 \min \left(\frac{N}{E}, \frac{E}{N}\right)^{4}\right\rfloor$ points.
